labels.any_activities: 3. Any activities in this Tax Period?
labels.activity_note: [If Selected "No" Please Fill Only Section I, II & X]
purchase_instruction: 1) If all the products/services you supply are standard rated, fill up note 10-20.
2) All the products/services you supply are not standard rated or input tax credit not taken within stipulated time period under section 46, fill up note 21-22.

3) If the products/services you supply consist of both standard rated and non-standard rated, then fill up note 10-20 for the raw materials that were used to produce/supply standard rated goods/services and fill up note 21-22 for the raw materials that were used to produce/supply non-standard rated goods/services and show the value proportionately in note 10-22 as applicable.
labels.interest_refund: I am interested to get refund of my Closing Balance
labels.declaration_text: I hereby declare that all information provided in this Return Form are complete, true & accurate. In case of any untrue/incomplete statement, I may be subjected to penal action under The Value Added Tax and Supplementary Duty Act, 2012 or any other applicable Act prevailing at present.

return_options: D) Full or Additional or Alternative Return (Section 67)

titles.gov: Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh

info.first_supply: Date of first supply as per declared coefficient:

footer.auth_person_title: Name of Authorized Person of the Institution:
notes: Declaration must be submitted online or to the divisional office 15 days before first supply.
New declaration is required if the price of goods or raw materials changes by more than 7.5%.
Bill of Entry or Challan must be attached as proof of raw material purchase.

titles.gov: Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh

notes: All types of purchase information related to economic activities must be included in this form.

In cases where goods are purchased from an unregistered person, the full name, address, and National ID number of said person must be compulsorily mentioned in the relevant columns [(7), (8), and (9)].
Copies of the Bill of Entry or Invoice must be preserved as supporting documents for the purchase of raw materials.
